website_summaries.verdict: An accurate, long-lived and durable sight, its red dot is generally clear except at brighter settings.
pros: Maintains its accuracy even after hundreds of rounds have been fired
Dot is clear and easy to see at all settings
Easy to mount to most rifles
cons: Sight may loosen up after several firings, particularly with high-powered rifles
Red dot is blurry for some users, especially at high settings

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE Good optic for the price. This is the newer model with the white bushnell lettering and the red dot DOES disappear at around the 10 o'clock when you look through it at a certain angle. But as long as it's mounted it shouldn't really be much of an issue. I just wish bushnell would've kept the original model! Other than that it's still a good optic. Makes my dpms look good. And when you recieve your optic the battery is already in it and there's a clear lens that keeps the battery from touching the battery mount so be sure to remove that or else it won't work!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca & Alex

customer_reviews.title: I'd stake my life on this optic.
customer_reviews.text: I've run these on several different rifles. Never had a single issue with one. They keep zero, hold up well to the recoil of even 30 cal rifles, aren't affected by rain, and stay solid on the gun. I like the variable red dot brightness and ease of adjustments. This is like a poor man's aimpoint. I'd go so far as to say that if you're on a budge, I'd even be willing to put it on a combat or duty rifle. Mine have held up through thousands of rounds, several rifle courses, and many competitions. Well worth the money and weight. Highly recommended. I am comfortable staking my life on this product.
customer_reviews.author: John Scout

customer_reviews.title: Loses dot after a few shots.
customer_reviews.text: Was all excited to use this with my Browning Buckmark at the Bullseye club. Looks great. Feels great. BUT...the red dot goes out all the time. After one shot I have to turn the dial to a number, any number, to get the dot to reappear. I finally took the battery out (brand new, by the way) and put back in. Dot lasted maybe 20 seconds. Some kind of short, or connection issue. I finally quit shooting.today,as all I was doing was wasting ammo, very disappointed. Going to have someone look at it to see if they can figure it out. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Riv's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long with 7.62x39
customer_reviews.text: After less than 100 rounds of 7.62x39 the LED stopped working. I can usually jiggle the control and get it to light again, but it will go out again the very next shot. I took it off my gun, it's useless for both plinking and hunting without a red dot.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Ekedahl

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality; you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a year and a half. At first, it seemed like a good bargain solution for a 10/22 takedown I just wanted a quick and easy red dot on. Used very lightly for 13 mos (12 mos warranty, of course), probably only 6 of those mounted to the rifle, and subsequently during an Appleseed weekend the battery cap promptly popped off while firing. Now it won't go back on; threads don't seem to engage properly and the combination of spring tension/rubber o-rings pops it back off either immediately or after firing a few rounds. I have the battery held in with tape for now until I can fund a replacement with a better warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in GA

customer_reviews.title: Well that didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Holds zero -Cheap -Can be mounted low for non-AR's (great MP-5 height imho) -The lenses haven't fallen out... yet Cons: -Flickers or turns off unless brightness knob is perfectly in the notch -Brightness knob notches are muddy and impossible to tell exactly where it wants to be -Turns off under firing as the brightness knob gets knocked out of perfect alignment -Lens quality is poor, has noticeable staring of the dot on anything but the lowest brightness settings and no, it isn't just my eyes. Other higher quality dots don't do that. -Worked great for about 1000 rounds of .22LR, started having the turn off/flicker problem after that. Don't even think about 223 or 9mm with this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Williams

customer_reviews.title: Paperweight
customer_reviews.text: I really wish this red dot sight worked. Mine arrived with white lettering on the side. Got to a range a couple weeks after it arrived to find that the optic WOULD NOT ZERO. The elevation and windage screws loosen but don't hold position or do anything for the position of the dot for that matter. Reached out to Bushnell to let them correct their mistake but never got a reply. Excellent customer service 👌🙄 Decided to initiate an Amazon return but apparently the window closed 2 days ago 😡 Next time I'm bypassing the company and just returning to amazon. This thing is useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Cheap, Small, Red dot sight
customer_reviews.text: I was aware of the reviews, warning of the differences between earlier(gold lettering) and current(white lettering). I'm happy to say that Bushnell has corrected the new versions flaws. It has a crisp red dot, a firm and positive brightness knob, the emitter is at the 4:30 position and can be seen clearly. It doesn't interfere with Co-witness and doesn't disappear at 10 o'clock. It is rugged enough to make a airline trip across country and held it's zero. I'm gonna buy more and recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this red dot on my Mossberg 500 with rifled slugs. It stays on point, zeroed even with a 12 gauge, which is impressive to me. Those 3 inch cartridges are some hot rounds that pack a punch. I've only bought cheaper red dots in the past, and not a single one of them would stay zeroed when I put them on my 12 gauge. The Bushnell Trophy TRS-25 truly fits the old saying - you get what you pay for. There's a reason some red dots are 20 bucks and some are closer to $100 or higher. Its because they can be mounted on a high recoil rifle and stay zeroed. I love this red dot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it. Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great red dot for the price. I put it on my Ruger 22/45 Lite pistol with no problems. Zero'd it in at 25 yards and ran 500 rounds through it without a single problem Zero stayed right where it should be and the mount was rock solid. I got the white lettering version and my LED is at the 4:30 position. The red dot is visible through all of the glass and is the same intensity no matter where I look through it. The dial is a bit stiff but with use it should loosen up. I'll probably get another one for an SBR I'm building.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Voils

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great red dot but mine arrived without the lens cover. **Update** I returned the Bushnell TRS-25 and orderred a replacement due to the missing cover. The replacement scope arrived in a sealed Bushnell box. The box contained a plastic wrapped scope with working battery and lens cover, plastic wrapped cleaning cloth, plastic wrapped allen key, and instruction manual. The battery cover also had a yellow instruction sticker stuck on it. Based on the packaging I now realize the previous order wasn't NEW. In addition to the missing cover the only plastic wrapped item was the allen key and the yellow instruction sticker was missing from the battery cover. Still a great red dot scope but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Pure garbage.
customer_reviews.text: First attempt to use this the dot wasn’t a dot at all but rather a noticeable cluster of dots almost like the beginning of a fireworks explosion going off. After requesting replacement the replacement came in damaged as if someone already returned it once and the battery was dead on top of having the same cluster issue. I’ve owned many Red dot sights and not one of them ever had this problem. It’s garbage and has been Hugh waste of time trying to deal with this. There are plenty other sites out there get one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Valentin

customer_reviews.title: My experience did not measure up to most others.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this red dot in August 2019. It attached easily and was quick to zero in. It has never been used in the field, only at an enclosed range. I use it on my James River Armory reproduction M1 carbine. This carbine is considered a personal defense weapon that fires a 30 caliber bullet. There is very little recoil. I have fired less than a thousand rounds with the scope and it is now acting very erratically. Sometimes it will be fine and then several rounds later the dot disappears and then reappears after a few more rounds. I have changed the battery and cleaned the contact but this has not resolved the problem. I figure I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Seeg

customer_reviews.title: Red Blob Scope... Not Dot
customer_reviews.text: I opened mine and was first surprised to see finger marks on the lenses. I turned it on and the “dot” is a blob. The blob looks like a ghost... a ghost flying diagonally , to make it worse. Do I pick the head or part of the tail as the point of impact.? I’m inclined to think the fingerprints on it indicates the person prior to me also finds that unacceptable. Boxing it back up for a return 15 minutes after opening. I’ll choose another brand.
customer_reviews.author: GMac

customer_reviews.title: No, No, and No!
customer_reviews.text: Update after another couple hundred rounds. At first I was really happy with the site after shooting a couple hundred rounds through both my 10/22 and 9mm carbine (I bought two). I was so happy with the results, I bought a third site to put on my 7.62x39. HOWEVER... after shooting another couple hundred rounds through both my 10/22 and 9mm, both sites started shutting off from the recoil on BOTH guns. In the 9mm I discovered that my red dot was actually three red dots. I returned all three sites. Sorry Bushnell. I really hoped these would work.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: JUNK AND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: This optic would not adjust left or right no matter what i did. I sent it back to Bushnell and it returned. Instead of having one red dot in the middle, it had clusters of red dots all over the place. There are at least 50 red dots in there, AFTER IT RETURNED FROM REPAIR!. It's junk! I haven't even bothered to send it back to Bushnell because the customer service was so bad, and that was long before Covid 19 shut us all down! LOOK ELSEWHERE FOR A RED DOT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: shoddy
customer_reviews.text: in years passed i have pursed three of these sights and was well pleased. now i bought another, the first they sent was defective. first 3 light levels did not work, sent it back. the second one they sent lowest light level is to bright to use at night, like my old models. also front lens glued in crooked. got refund. this sight was once a great item, but not anymore!
customer_reviews.author: oldfort

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see the dot in sunlight
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this for my sons 10/22 rifle I got him for his birthday. Looks great, feels good. But the dot is so dim inside my house, you can’t even see it when you take it outside. I thought maybe I got a bad battery. Ordered new batteries and popped them in, no change. Thought maybe I had the brightness scale mixed up, ran it through all 11 settings still dim. So this sight is junk to me, what’s the point if I can’t use it outside. Don’t have any indoor shooting ranges nearby so I’m stuck with a $80 paperweight. Thanks bushnell!
customer_reviews.author: Kandy Buesa

customer_reviews.title: Beware Before Buying
customer_reviews.text: The item I received was not new. The protective sticker on the battery was missing and the unit was left turned on so the battery was dead, it was obvious from the interior of the box it didn't come straight from the factory. There were fingerprints all over the lenses and the objective lens was glued in badly, excess glue and at at about a 10-15 degrees angle to where it should be. May be I just got unlucky and this was a bad one someone had returned that mistakenly got back in the system, but I really had to question if this is actually a Bushnell unit or some sort of knock off version.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Sure as shootin’
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on an AR10. Used a .83 riser and it co-witnessed perfectly with the iron sights. It’s made “over there”, but you can tell it’s well built, especially at this price. Never had a problem with Bushnell products. I bought a Cmore tac rail red dot, figuring it would win the contest and I’d send this one back. Nope. The Bushnell had a wider field and felt solid. Easy adjustments that click when you un screw the caps. Light and small. I did get the newer one with white lettering, but never owned the old gold lettered edition. This seems fine to me.
customer_reviews.author: justjoe

customer_reviews.title: worked well for two years
customer_reviews.text: The product was great for two years until a few days ago when at the range I laid the rifle down on a table and picked it up a few minutes later the dot was in the far bottom left. After some exercise in futility I stopped trying to readjust it and noticed the interior tube had detached from the exterior housing. I can only assume the heat from the high 80s temperature caused the adhesive to fail. I feel I got my moneys worth out of it for two years but next time I'll probably spend extra on an aimpoint pro.
customer_reviews.author: KennedyL84

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality control. I purchased two of these and the lenses on both of them were tilted at an angle. The red dots were very different between the two. I have purchased four of these previously. Three were decent at $50. The fourth one I purchased as a gift, and it had a damaged lense, also. I took a chance on these last two because there was nothing else available. What a waste of time and money...Amazon now charges a pick up fee for returns. I will not buy another one and suggest you don’t either!
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: It’s garbage
customer_reviews.text: Put it on my Ak and all was well at first. The dot was more like an oval than a crisp dot but it didn’t bother me too much. I got it zero’d in at 25 yards and it was dead on accurate. Then I began to rapid fire with double taps and the dot went out on me. Now the dot flickers on certain brightness settings and doesn’t work at all on other brightness settings. 1-5 works fine until I actually fire the weapon. Then it goes out again. Maybe I got a lemon because I expect better from Bushnell. I’m looking else where now for a new budget red dot. Big disappointment Bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: yup

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Bushnell
customer_reviews.text: Bushnell back in the day produced quality products, they must have moved to China quality. I googled this scope and the reviews were good, some had differences between the red or white printed types. I didn’t fully understand so I purchased one hoping for the best. Easy to Mount but sighting it in was problematic because the direction arrows on the adjusters were reversed. After figuring that out at full brightness there seems to be three red dots or shadows. I was disappointed that Bushnell would put their name on such a faulty product. I am shooting today and will find out how accurate and dependable it is but don’t have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Buonocore

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest optic I'd bet my life on
customer_reviews.text: And I do mean cheapest. You can find better optics, but you'll spend more, and you can find cheaper optics, but you will sacrifice reliability. I think this represents the bare minimum amount of money you can spend on an optic that will take a lickin' and keep on tickin' as the saying goes. I haven't tortured mine (it lives on my 10/22), but I know people who have, on ARs, AKs, and PCCs, and they swear by it.
customer_reviews.author: SA7

customer_reviews.title: Inspect it before the return window expires
customer_reviews.text: Received mine today. The lens is installed terribly crooked. I've had a few Bushnell optics over the years and never had a problem. Always really clear and reliable. Apparently quality control isn't what it was a few years ago. Returned it for a replacement. Will update when the replacement comes in.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: The ones that cost half this units price are superior and have better customer service
customer_reviews.text: This optic has no quality control. This is the second one I have purchased in the last year, and both have crooked glass, REALLY crooked glass. I will say from experience because I own both, but the feyachi brand that looks identical does not have this issue, at half the price and you dont have to have a brand name stamped on it. In case your wondering the crooked glass causes a sort of fish eye effect and also grabs reflections terrible. Also, if you do gamble on this item, een sold and shipped by amazon they are forving me to print and package my return for only this item.
customer_reviews.author: john demuth

customer_reviews.title: 2 failures in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought one about 6 weeks ago; after two range sessions of less than 100 rounds each on a NAK9 and it gave out. Swapped the battery, still would turn back off after every shot. Amazon ordered a replacement - first range out - less than 20 rounds it turned off and wouldn’t come back on. I wouldn’t recommend since both the original and replacement failed in the same way in a short period.
customer_reviews.author: V Sansonetti

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: This is an adequate optic for hunting or fun. The battery life leaves something to be desired for a home defense weapon. I've run one battery out on an Aimpoint (took about a year and a half). I run about a battery a month out on this (after a month it's too dim to use except in darkness). Handles recoil on a 12 gauge with high brass buckshot just fine. I haven't done anything crazy with it, but handles training classes and range time just fine. So if you just turn it on to use for a few hours and then turn it back off it should handle your needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Doma

customer_reviews.title: Legit Cost Friendly Red Dot
customer_reviews.text: For the cost you get a good red dot that stays on zero, is pretty durable, and has excellent battery life. I've used it on a snappy 7.5" AR15 Pistol for a couple of years, and now it's on Ruger PC9 Carbine that has more than 700 rounds through it. The red dot has done great. The only down side is the "halo" you get when you turn up the brightness past 7, 8, 9, and to 10. Not really a big deal for me because I usually use levels 5-6. I would give it 3 stars for this but for general plinking and normal use this is solid option and the cost alone takes it to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bonesman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic red dot
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this optic can't be beat. I like it so much, I bought a second one for another rifle. Battery life is fine, but not amazing. It works great on my .22 and .556. As other reviews have said, this is a great red dot in the context that it's half the price of its closest competitor, in my opinion. One thing to warn about is that the cross bolt on the mount strips very easily and is tough to get out, if that happens. I had to find replacement bolts a little bit longer than the OEM, and added a washer to leave the head exposed, which works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: rubberneck

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This thing was everything I thought it would be and more (for the money). I have this on a tactical Mossburg 500 with a 20" barrel, and I was shooting groups of 12 gauge slugs at 40 yards that were touching. I was shooting into direct sunlight and didn't have a single issue. Also, there were reviews about the glass having a slight green tint to it, and I have actually seen some in person this way, however, mine was perfectly clear. I don't know if they are making these better or if I just got lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Sight for the Money - Just Need to Zero It Properly
customer_reviews.text: Sight works well once you zero it properly. I tried (like a dummy) to zero it standing up and shooting my Ruger 10/22 Takedown. Once I sat and zeroed it on the bench and got it set up properly, it works like a champ. You still need to check your sight, whatever kind you buy before or after shooting to make sure it is still tight on the mount. After shooting for several sessions, it may loosen and thus go out of adjustment. Also, for Takedowns, make sure you tighten the barrel adjustment into the receiver to ensure accuracy. For $50.00, it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: if it doesn’t work it doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews as well as watching several You Tube review of the Bushnell TRS-25. All were very complimentary of the optic. So, I ordered one. I mounted it on a Ruger PC9. The first trip to the range to zero I had trouble keeping it on. Several shots and it turned off. The same thing happened on the next visit to the range. A Red Dot that will not stay on is useless. I returned to Amazon and received a refund. I then purchased a Vortex Viper no problems. I assume my TRS-25 was just a lemon but still if it doesn’t work it doesn’t work. I would buy another or recommend this optic.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not for a 12ga
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12ga. It mounts good and the brightness settings work well in numerous lighting conditions. However, I could not get it sighted in. I tried on 2 separate occasions until my shoulder was sore from the 3in slugs I was shooting. I swapped it out for an aimpoint and now my shotgun is dead on. I'm not sure if the recoil was the issue on this sight but I'm sure it was. Even though there are reviews saying you can put this on a shotgun I would stay away from it if that's your intended use. It would probably be great on a .22 or something close to that size.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Died as soon as I used it.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it took me more than a month to get out to test this because of the pandemic going on. I mounted it on my 22lr and after 3 shots it went dark! I thought maybe it was the battery so I bought a new battery and changed it out. It worked, but after a few more shots it went dark again! Piece of junk, made in China..... Because I took more than a month to test it out, I am past the return window. Would not buy again from Bushnell
customer_reviews.author: C. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Great but get a battery subscription
customer_reviews.text: Got one on sale so figured why not? Bright and seemed well built. Holds up to ar recoil no problem. However... Battery life is ATROCIOUS. Ok, its not listed for 50k hrs or evn 10k but I do expect to be able to leave it on lvl 8 for a day without seeing a marked decrease in brightness. For the way they keep dropping in price i will buy more but i have no illusions that if i go to the range, ill be putting a new battery in and tossing it at days end. Cant leave these on is the only real drawback for this sub $100 red dot
customer_reviews.author: Tommy j

customer_reviews.title: One DOA
customer_reviews.text: I've used these on many rifles, as have many of my friends. I guess I got complacent, because I didn't check them out within my 30 day window, but one will not turn on even with new batteries, the "technical tap" etc. As an electronics tech, I took it apart to see what was up and noticed nothing out of the ordinary except a few less than perfect solder points, but they were fine electrically. Tossed it in the garbage since I'm sure that codes any warranty, but be sure to check these before your return period is up!
customer_reviews.author: chris joren

customer_reviews.title: Returned two
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these scopes and the dial that adjusts the dot size was very hard to turn. Watching YouTube videos I found this can be an issue with this model. One video shows how to fix it but I didn’t want to take apart a brand new optic. I asked Amazon for a replacement and they sent a second one quickly, it had the same issue, so it too will be returned. I have one I bought two months ago on a shotgun and it works perfect, I’ll either get a different optic or buy this one again in person so that I can try the dial before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: IowaGunTrader

customer_reviews.title: TRS-25.  Price does equate quality on this one.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package, I thought the TRS-25 looked great. I put the battery in and turned it on. The red dot looked like a shotgun shot pattern of tiny red dots. I turned it off and back on and then had a giant halo around a single dot. I set it aside and started the return process. Checked it one more time the day I returned it and, low and behold, it stopped working. I was tempted to try and get another one but decided it would not be beneficial to have an optic that left that first impression. I got burned by trying a budget friendly red dot...
customer_reviews.author: RTC

customer_reviews.title: These have a positive rep for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Comparable to the Primary Arms Red Dot but a bit more of a premium feel. The dot itself is a little bigger but still small enough to be useful for relevant engagement ranges. I like that the illumination can be turned backwards to Max rather than having to spin the dial through all the settings. The caps are secure on W/E and the tacticle click of each adjustment is subtle (perhaps a bit too subtle for some folks). Overall, I'd buy this again if mine broke.
customer_reviews.author: WhatsThatNoise

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Good for 22LR.
customer_reviews.text: Beware. This like most inexpensive products has a round bolt or screw for the cross piece for the recoil stop. Most Picatinny rails are made of aluminum and will be marred or deformed by repeated recoil from a service rifle round. If you want good kit get square steel recoil bars on your scope rings and sights. This is not what you want on your .223 or .308 if you shoot it frequently. Yeah, round crossbolts are my pet peeve.
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: So good I brought TWO.
customer_reviews.text: If I had any complaints it would be that there's no auto on or off feature. The fact that this is a fraction of the price of others of the same quality it makes my complaint disappear. Since this isn't on any of my home defense firearms I don't care about an auto on or off feature. The brightness is on par with, in my opinion, the Primary Arms red dot. Which is probably it's closes competitor at double the price. The most important thing for me is that this thing can take a beating and still keep zero. Seriously, for fifty something bucks what more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Rico and Family

customer_reviews.title: I can see why it's so popular  Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: HOLDS ZERO! This is a major issue for so many low cost options. Fired a few dozen 5.56 and many dozen .22lr through it. No drift. Easy to adjust - very positive "clicks". Uses readily available batteries. Dot it small enough to not obscure the target too badly, particularly for the cost. Cons: I don't like the lens cover system. Not a big deal, but I'll probably try to find flip up caps.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Supreme performance for money!  In other words, VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: The Bushnell TRS-25 Riflescope is the very definition of value. This unit outperforms scopes at 5 times the price, all but the highest of top end units at over $500! Easy to install, easy to sight, easy to aim, easy to change the battery, optics are sharp. Just about the only minor deficiency to me is that the brightness selector is too tight to click from one setting to another. Try that with cold hands. I am very happy for $80.00!
customer_reviews.author: STABERDEARTH

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for centerfire guns
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of these now. Two of them have self destructed. First one was on a 9mm carbine, second on an AK47. Third is on a 22lr Rifle . That one is still ok. On the two defective ones the illumination turret loosened up and the unit lost zero. Actually I take that back. 3 of them fell apart. One was still under warranty and Bushnell replaced it, only to come apart. These seemed to be ok for a rimfire weapon but do not recommend for any centerfire weapons.
customer_reviews.author: pinzmann

customer_reviews.title: These used to be a great optic, not anymore. If you get one with bushnell in yellow its a keeper.  The newer ones with bushnell
customer_reviews.text: Way to ruin a great product thru poor qc. These used to be a great optic, not anymore. If you get one with bushnell in yellow its a keeper. The newer ones with bushnell in white are almost all trash. I own about 10 of these, they WERE my go to, I have STOPPED buying tehm.. Most of the new (white letters) have about 30 percent field of view limited by poor sensor placement and poor quality control. Sad that a business gets so big it stops caring about its product.
customer_reviews.author: my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Not made well, crooked front lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Clearly Bushnell isn't concerned with quality control anymore. I purchased two of these units after much recommendation from the industry and stellar reviews on here. The first two came with a crooked front lens so I returned one and let Amazon replace the other. The replacement TRS25 had the exact same problem (to a lesser degree), a crooked front lens. So to recap, I went through 3 of these and all 3 had defective front lenses.
customer_reviews.author: deepball1184

customer_reviews.title: Good sight
customer_reviews.text: I received the white lettered model. 100 rounds on the first range trip and its holding zero. Its accurate! The dot does stay visible when you look through it at different angles, BUT it does seem to flicker a bit. I used to be a true iron sight lover and thought that looking through a scope would take away from the field of view but it doesnt...youll get used to it and hit target every round. There seems to be no tint looking through it. UPDATE: The dot is getting worse and has split into two.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: Nice Red Dot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Bushnell Red Dot when it went on sale last time. I am very pleased with the quality and it seems to hold zero. I have used it through a lot of rounds at the range and it has not failed yet. I did buy a UTG rail mount to raise it up so that it would co-witness with my front sight. If you don't know about UTG stuff find out it is a great product for the money. Back to the Bushnell, the dot is bright and the controls work like they should. For the price especially if you can get it on sale you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Killian6pk

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice optic for the price. Clear glass and the dot works well. My only complaint is the dial on the top. The off position should be zero but I have to turn it back to 10 to power it off. Does not affect function, just a minor flaw. Holds zero well on my 357 magnum revolver.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina Luedtke

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for Ruger 10/22
customer_reviews.text: Before buying I did a lot of research and came to the conclusion that this product was a perfect paring for a 10/22. My primary use was squirrel hunting and have been using it now for a few months. Initial sighting was too easy, and for the ranges I am shooting at, it is dead on accurate. Fit and finish are all you could want and build quality is comparable to much higher priced items. For context, I live on a farm in Northern Wisconsin, and my guns are no more than tools. I take care of them but use them a lot and expect quality and reliablity! For the price you won’t be disappointed. I sure was not!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2boys

customer_reviews.title: Good starter red dot for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm very early in my gun collection, and just have one ar-15 that I got for less than $500. Problem is, I hated the iron sights. I also didn't want to get a sight that was worth half of what the rifle itself was worth. That seemed silly. After a bit of internet research, I came across this thing, and I am VERY glad I did! For well under $100, I can easily get a nice group out at 50 yards, and easily hit 4" targets at 25 yards while standing with a budget rifle. Just remember to turn it off when you're done... no auto-off feature.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J Hengst

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy Bushnell again. I have gone through two of these things and both of them have the same issues. They cut off after every shot. After they cut off, I twist the brightness knob and they cut back on. I wasted $80 on this junk. I will be contacting Bushnell because now it's too late to return to Amazon. Do not buy this junk. UPDATE: did some research into this. THIS IS COUNTERFIT! Thats why it is junk. Not sure how to fix this because IDK what to do now (Amazon wont help me, im past the return date) So, I guess im just screwed. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Peter_1990

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother for any serious caliber rifle round.
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these red dots. They seem solid/OK, but any semi auto above a pistol caliber cartridge will cause issues. I have experienced this occasionally with 9mm, and often with 556 rounds, being shot at a steady pace. I noticed that the red dot will not hold point of aim / center. Also, and MOST IMPORTANTLY, firing the rifle/firearms will actually shift the on/off/brightness dial setting. Thus risking it to turn off, lower/increase brightness, or get stuck in between two dial settings. Buy for small caliber rounds, or for something you do not plan to shoot often.
customer_reviews.author: Karanji

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The front lense popped out on me when I mounted it to a 12ga, although I shouldn't be too surprised, it's a cheap optic afterall. Was working great on my 5.56 and 7.62 rifles, although I've since gotten rid of red dots on those platforms in favor of magnified scopes (since my eyesight is poor). Fit and finish is good. Dot is decent, not the crispest, and 4 MOA. It's ok. Nothing to rave about, but nothing to trash as total garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a 10/22 Takedown
customer_reviews.text: It fit my Ruger 10/22 Takedown just right so it can still fit in the carry bag. I’m able to get pretty tight groupings at 25 & 50 yards. I’m sure someone who’s better at shooting than myself will get better groups. It had 11 brightness settings and 11 being the highest. I could see it with no problem when shooting in the middle of a sunny day. I’ve heard it may not hold zero on heavier recoiling rifles but it holds zero just fine for a .22 LR. Would highly recommend. I don’t have night vision so I can’t comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell TRS 25 - Forget it !
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I have received. All 3 were unusable. Too stiff adjust knob, distorted or blurred red dot. Bushnell customer service very poor. I finally talked Bushnell customer service into taking the 3rd one back and sending one that they hand picked for quality. Prepare to hold on the phone for at 30 min. They do not respond to emails. If this 3rd one doesn't work (I haven't taken it to the rang yet) it goes in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: bunny

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite red dot...when I don't feel like an aimpoint
customer_reviews.text: This has turned out to be a great little red dot. Holds up to the recoil of my Mossberg 590a1 using full power 00 buck and rifled slugs. Quick and simple to zero, mounting was quick and the battery life so far seems to pretty decent. Haven't really had a chance to do anything serious as far as destructive testing but there are plenty of videos and articles out there by guys that have. If you are looking for a nice, budget friendly optic that works, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: AMasterofMayheM

customer_reviews.title: The dot is only visible on cloudy days
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this sight but am a little disappointed. I mounted it on my Remington 11-87 for deer season and bore sighted it with my laser... pretty simple. The problem is with the brightness of the dot. It's visible early and late in the day during reduced light times but when the sun is out during bright daylight times the dot cannot be seen at all. The battery is new and the sight is set at the highest brightness setting and still is not visible.
customer_reviews.author: JohnK

customer_reviews.title: Great budget Red dot.
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, this is an excellent budget red dot scope. Once sighted, stays sighted. The 3 moa red dot reticle is more than adequate 100 yards and in. I have mine sighted in at 25 yards and 300 yards. With a slightly low hold for 200 yards. Just make sure you understand how the minute of angle works so you understand your grouping. At 100 3”, 200 6”, and 300 9”. On an AR platform you will probably need at least a .83 riser. If you are going to add a magnifier you’ll probably need a 1” riser. I have a UTG 3x magnifier on mine. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a solid red dot for an AR-15. Took it to the range recently and was very impressed. From 75 yards I was getting one inch groupings . When mounted, it's very solid and there is no movement. The brightness exceeded my expectations and I could clearly see the red dot on a bright day using just the 4/5 brightness setting. I like that it comes with lens covers and it feels solid and well built. I recommend getting a riser because it makes it more comfortable when aiming down the site.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: White and Yellow logo is nonsense it’s quality control!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I thought there is a debate about how white bushnell label red dot disappear at an angle and the yellow bushnell does not. Well I got the white label bushnell and I can see at all angles without any problems. Update so I purchased another one because I was so pleased and actually got the yellow label so was very happy. Once installed I noticed red dot fades at different angles. So the myth about white label logos fading at different angles is nonsense. In the process of returning the yellow label logo one.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment threads weak and vulnerable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as an open box item but like new condition. It arrived in original packaging with the battery cover threads stripped and impossible to secure. The screwdriver slot on the top was badly scarred and the battery was dead. It was totally unusable even if I had purchased a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: Shocktherapy

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, but overall good value.
customer_reviews.text: Best quality I have had from a made in China product. I wish the description said where it was made, but I’m guessing Less people would not buy it. Good value overall. The red dot is Not super sharp, but for the price I don’t think you can get better quality. Over I am happy with this product. Would not use it on a service weapon, might use it as a backup for home defense or on my wife’s rifle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4life

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this was a knock off or if they are just built as well as from years back. The first unit sent had a decent size dent out of box and had to have left the factory like that since the box was not damaged at all. I mounted the second unit on my 9mm carbine and the front lens walked out. I am guessing from the recoil? Sometimes times things are just good enough to let you down when you need it most.
customer_reviews.author: Lowroller

customer_reviews.title: Fantistic dot sight
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now mounted on 9mm carbines. My old eyes have problems seeing the front sight but with this dot sight mounted as a co-witness set up with a blitzkrieg front sight I'm back in business. I got the first one a couple of years ago and it is still working perfectly. Be sure to put a couple of extra batteries in your gear bag in case you forget to turn it off as I have done a few times. Adjustments are simple and it holds very well once zeroed in. At this price point I don't believe you will find a better rifle red dot.
customer_reviews.author: scott in sparks

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these. I was on a tight budget when I purchased my first. What can I say, it has a long battery life, decent glass and many brightness settings. From the 1st til the 3rd these have worked every time I needed. Batteries are really cheap too. So my advice, if you aren't kicking doors and running and gunning professionally, this is a solid red dot that will give you many hours of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Dtwn92

customer_reviews.title: Great value - but not for self-defense
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these Bushnell Reddots and have been through 2 or 3 more. Bushnell is great about replacing the ones that fail or break. For $50 these are amazing for plinking guns, practice, etc. The quality is not there. These are not battle rifle quality, and I would never put one on a defensive firearm, any more than I would trust my life to cheap chinese parts for any other critical equipment in a life-dependency chain.
customer_reviews.author: Arian J Evans

customer_reviews.title: I mounted this on a Taurus Raging Bull. 44 ...
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on a Taurus Raging Bull .44 magnum. Previously I had several other "inexpensive" sights mounted on it. None of them survived more than a few range trips. So far this little guy has survived over 250 rounds, and 1 accidental drop. The dot is a bit blurry comparing to "premium" sights, but it held zero after several cleaning and remounting sessions. My target acquisition time with revolver is much faster with this sight.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This product out of the box preformed to the high standard as expected. However, there was something wrong internally that caused it to short circuit. I called customer service at Bushnell and received the most prompt and professional customer service and an upgraded replacement at no cost. I explained the issues, packaged and returned as requested and received the replacement (trs26) within 2 business days! Very pleased all the way around. I would have been perfectly fine with a replacement of the trs25 as prompt as it was, but the upgrade speaks to Quality of service you get from bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Shea

customer_reviews.title: Good dot from past experience but....
customer_reviews.text: Just got it out the box. Two issues found right away. One, knob is rock hard to move. Two, when turning knob and switching intensity, red dot disappears and wont come on unless you move knob around. sometimes it would not come on at all. too inconsistent. the older trs-25 with the gold letters was much better quality and rock solid. returned this item for a refund and will try something else.
customer_reviews.author: GINGERBREADMAN

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made !Lens covers a soft thin rubber on a stretch cord. Covers will not stay on the lens. Typical crap made in China. I will no longer buy another product made in China. By USA! Support out businesses even if cost a few $$ more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great price great product
customer_reviews.text: literally minutes after it was delivered I took it out of the box took it to the range and mounted it onto my AR. I mounted it on a canted rail simply because I have an ACOG on my AR. Upon getting it sighted in I realized what a good purchase this was. Bright, very easy to mount, very easy to use, and great for the price. I highly recommend this over any other more expensive or even cheaper red dot sights.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Henderson

customer_reviews.title: ... is my second TRS-25 and I can't say enough good things about it
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TRS-25 and I can't say enough good things about it. On both centerfire and rimfire rifles this red dot sight works well, holds zero, and is an excellent affordable option for the average shooting enthusiast. The attached target photo was at 25 yards using a Ruger 10/22 with the TRS-25 and Aguila Super Extra 40gr. CPRN .22lr.
customer_reviews.author: TechyNerd

customer_reviews.title: Blurred disappearing dot
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the first time and the dot was very blurry. Requested a replacement and again the dot was blurry and it would disappear when viewed from certain angles and take time to reacquire. Wasn't expecting what a high end red light delivers but still was very disappointed with the lack of the basic expectation.
customer_reviews.author: senada

customer_reviews.title: mostly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This went onto a 12 Gauge shotgun with a 3" chamber for Turkey hunting. It was almost perfectly on target before adjusting and makes sighting so much easier that that little brass bead. Haven't put enough rounds out to swear by it's ability to maintain zero long term, but it has done so through 15 rounds. The lightness adjusting dial is very hard to spin, I often find the battery cover being unscrewed instead.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: A lot of scope for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this red dot scope mounted to a Monstrum Lockdown Series Adjustable Height Picatinny Riser Mount with Quick Release (5 stars) on my sub2K. After adjustment with a bore sight, it hits what the dot is on. Bushnell has made a very good scope at an affordable price. 11 settings for dot brightness helps in any light situation. I do get a lot of flare if the sun is behind me, which is why I also zero my iron sights.
customer_reviews.author: SocratesinLove

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING VALUE
customer_reviews.text: GREAT VALUE. I use it on my 12ga. I only use it within 50 yds but it hits my target with rifled slugs. WOULD PURCHASE AGAIN. ACCURACY: honestly about 3MOA. Probably my gun. I’m shooting rifled slugs. I’m not a great accuracy data point. RELIABILITY: OUTSTANDING. been using it 7 years now. Works every time. Even with heavy recoil. BATTERY LIFE: OUTSTANDING. I don’t remember the last time I changed the batteries. It’s been Years and they still work. BRIGHTNESS: I’ve shot outdoor and indoor. It’ll go brighter than you’ll ever need. Or super dim if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Delivers for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for what I’m doing with it. I bought an M&P 15-22 and this cheap little guy performs great so far. First time gun owner and I had low expectations for a sub $100 red dot and it performed great. Took about 50 rounds to zero it in. Shooting 2” groupings for a beginner at 25yds is more than expected. Now I wouldn’t expect the same results outdoors or at 300yds. But for me it works great as an entry level optic. Not planning on putting this on a shotgun or bolt action so I’m not trying to push this thing to it’s limits.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Budget minded decent option
customer_reviews.text: Fun little red dot. Definitely not a top of the line optic, but it’s a red dot. Could you spend more money and get a better product? Sure, but do you really need it? Bought this for a budget pistol I wanted to cowitness a red dot on, and it’s held up nicely. Is it a super tactical, show off how much money you got, make all your special forces navy seal dreams come true red dot? No, but it shines a red dot and doesn’t fall apart after hundreds of rounds. Go have some fun and don’t forget to turn it off. Simple as that. Comes with a battery too!
customer_reviews.author: ScranScran

customer_reviews.title: I will repurchase this
customer_reviews.text: This site is amazing. I was worried that due to it being a 25 mm tube diameter that I would have a difficult time acquiring the red dot but that was not the case at all. Finding the reticle on this 25 mm tube is just as easy as any 30 mm tube. I sighted my Ruger 10/22 with just 12 rounds I didn't have to adjust windage at all at 25 yards. I also bought two different risers for this site just in case I didn't like where it's at but that's not a problem either. Honestly I plan on buying a few more of these
customer_reviews.author: Billy Meat Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening, I was hopeful for the product because I have purchased many Bushnell products over the years. It looked simple, but well made. Unfortunately after shooting it on a AR15 platform, the red dot disappeared from view. I then noticed the lense on the front had tweeted a bit. I have sent 2 emails to their website and got their robo response that they would get back to me. It’s been over a month. Very disappointing to say the least. Done with Bushnell
customer_reviews.author: Robert White

customer_reviews.title: Well-made but very dim
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy brightness adjustment and the solid construction. It never stuttered under 12 ga or 5.56 recoil but it was barely visible in bright daylight. I also found the dot to be very small which did not help with the visibility problems. If you need a budget optic for use in an indoor self defense gun, this would be a great option, but it's no good for outdoor shooting.
customer_reviews.author: TopGun4815

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction. A bit dim even on highest setting. Not like they used to be made
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. Durable but not very bright. In a normal sunny day the dot is way too dim This is a durable product. Its not very bright. I can hardly see the dot - in any reasonable light - at the max setting. So to me it's almost useless. My kids are OK. But one would expect 10/11 to be overly bright and not minimum necessary to even consider using the product. Note that my older ones (at least 5+) are decent. But everything remotely new has been dim and dissapointing. I've ensured mine are not counterfeits. I've switched to Sig.
customer_reviews.author: MH.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sight
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it for night time but I have predator issues so I'll give it a shot. Solid. Don't forget to turn off when not in use. Sucks battery fmdry fast if you do. I got to the range the first time with it and it sucked the battery dry that week in the case. I carry spares now in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Huntsman69

customer_reviews.title: Real deal
customer_reviews.text: I received my red dot two days ago, and haven't had a chance to zero yet, but here are my first impressions; Real deal Bushnell, not a knock off. Build quality is good. Red dot is damn bright at anything above a 4 or 5 on the selector, so I think 5 will be my limit for most lighting conditions. Like I said, haven't fired the weapon yet, but I like the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Discworldfan

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it but the red dot is a lopsided red starbusrt
customer_reviews.text: I want to love it but the red dot is a lopsided red starburst. Even on lower settings the starburst can be seen its very annoying for smaller target shooting but not a major problem for broader mass shots. It does look a lot better outdoors than indoors (most of my shooting as at an indoor range). The parallax is very acceptable at about 75' I don't think there is any. All in all I'd recommend going with another brand the blown out star burst dot is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Best red dot on a budget. This is the cheapest I’d go on an optical, that being said for the quality of this sight you’d think you spent more. 11 brightness settings is awesome for variable light conditions or saving battery life. Battery life is really good and batteries are cheap for this anyways. Mounts hold and lock tight. Amazing sight that you can’t beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrezina

customer_reviews.title: Good optic
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy high end optics. I took a chance and purchased this to put on my PCP pistol. this red dot is great. Good clarity, dot is round, I wish it could be purchased with a choice of a bigger dot. I have had this for a few months and hasn't needed to be re-zeroed. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another of these. In fact I may get one but don't have a need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check your battery!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had bought a green dot. I can see the red but not as well as green on some other firearms I have. That being said I had started a return. I thought my eyes were playing tricks on me, as I could not see the red dot after the second day. I didn't leave it on overnight but the red dot was hard to see the next day. Well I decided to change the battery out just too see. Low and behold I could see it again. Since I had to change battery out and waste ammo in relighting my firearm again is the reason I am giving it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: American1219

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged
customer_reviews.text: This order arrived on time with a problem, the spring in the lid of the battery cap was not affixed to the cap. It looks like it had a dab of some sort of glue in the cap, but it came apart and of course it will not work. Perhaps, you can tell me what kind of glue will hold it in place properly so that I do not have to go to the hassle of sending it back. I'm a disabled Vet and really do not want to half to wait in line at the Post Office. Any help would be thankful.
customer_reviews.author: glennon .

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money on a name.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an AR I built for my grandfather. Mounted it up and went to the range. I am so impressed with this sight. I paid 3-4 times as much for my vortex, while it's a great sight it is in no way better than this one by Bushnell. Great sight!!! Buy this one and stick the $300 you save into other parts or better yet a good barrel.
customer_reviews.author: Medic

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed will not last long if your lens is set poorly.
customer_reviews.text: Received the Bushnell red dot optic today and when I opened the box the first thing I checked was the lens position. I read several reviews stating the lens was tilted. Well...I am adding my voice to the others who have posted. Optic lenses are NOT supposed to be misaligned in optic tube, it should be flush. I am disappointed. Please do not waste your time. Shame on you Bushnell! I typically love your products but this one is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jordon P.

customer_reviews.title: Possible counterfeit, not same as older models.
customer_reviews.text: I have three older Bushnell TRS-25s. This one does not compare to the old ones at all. The one that I received from Amazon may even be counterfeit, makes sense it was half the price as my others ($47 vs $90). The older one has bluer tint, way brighter, and orange Bushnell font on the side. The new one has clear glass, half as bright dot, and white logo font. I'll have to put this one on my .22 not going ok anything bigger...
customer_reviews.author: Jakeg

customer_reviews.title: Works well, nothing fancy, simple, reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well rated, basic nothing fancy red-dot sight that has been around for a long while. It's reported to hold up well to repeated recoils. Offers Bushnell reliability over an off-brand hope-and-pray purchase. We prefer red-green dot combo sights for use with red-dot bore-sight lasers but this TRS-25 is fine. We received the newer model with the white Bushnell logo lettering as opposed to the older model's gold Bushnell lettering that some owners hold in higher regard WRT performance. No problem noted to date.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatic

customer_reviews.title: Died with less than 300 rounds through it
customer_reviews.text: Had it just under a year, so warranty still good, BUT...I'm no paying to ship it back and then paying another $10 for them to ship it back. It's mounted on a 7.62x39 AR that I rarely used, less than 100 rounds through it when I took it out today. At 100 rounds more, started blinking off when I fired the rifle. Changed the battery, it flashed on and off for about 20 rounds then died completely. The older ones were great, the new ones...nah, I'll pay a little more and get something that will last and has a better warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, smeared dot, halos
customer_reviews.text: the dot becomes a blob at brightness levels 6 and above; at 8 you get a halo; lots of reflections during daylight; may be an OK scope for an indoor range but not for outdoors. have to re-zero after after removing&reinstalling
customer_reviews.author: Russ Foul

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the low price fool you. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I did what most people will probably do and invested in a cheap red dot sight thinking that a red dot is a red dot. Let me tell you, this is not the case. I purchased one for less than $30. When I received it, I turned it on and the dot was so fuzzy that you could not possibly use it accurately. However, for the small price point, this Bushnell red dot is an excellent investment. The dot is crisp and centered. It is built tough, has coated optics , and comes with a battery that actually has a charge. I installed it on My AR and could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: StarWarsFan

customer_reviews.title: unacceptable quality control
customer_reviews.text: we've gone through 5 looking for one that worked. on all, the brightness adjustment knob is almost impossible to turn. the battery door is flimsy (and has an almost unremovable sticker on it). something happened to these when they came out with the new version (as others have stated). our old ones are just fine. in the meantime, the price has gone up 40%
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Bushnell Trophy TRS-25 Red Dot Sight Riflescope, 1x25mm, Black
product_meta.description:
731303 Features: -Trophy red dot scope. -Multi-coated optics. -Amber-Bright high contrast lens coating. -Dry-nitrogen filled. Product Type: -Red Dot Sights. Generic Dimensions: -Length: 2.4''. Dimensions: Overall Depth - Front to Back: -2.4 Inches.

AMAZON.COM


Blazing target acquisition. Peak Accuracy. And bright enough to hunt even the thickest woods. You’ll only find this level of performance in our new Trophy Red Dot Sights.

There's nothing like a red dot for fast target acquisition and accuracy in dim conditions, and no one makes red dots like Bushnell. The TRS-25 1x25 red dot is engineered with Amber-Bright optics to help you quickly distinguish between a brown tree and a brown critter. Amber-Bright is just one reason Trophy riflescopes have been heralded as the ideal scope for the autumn deer woods. And thanks to the scope's multicoated optics, hunters will have no problem seeing their target in low-light conditions. Other features include a 100-percent waterproof/fogproof/shockproof construction, a dry-nitrogen-filled housing, and a CR2032 battery. 

Features:

 * 3 MOA Red Dot
 * Multi-coated optics
 * Amber-Bright™ high contrast lens coating
 * 100% waterproof/fogproof/shockproof construction
 * CR2032 battery

Specifications:

 * Finish: Matte
 * Power / Obj Lens: 1 x 25mm
 * Reticle: 3 MOA Red Dot
 * Field of View (ft@100 yds. / m@100 m): Unlimited
 * Weight (oz./g): 3.7 / 106
 * Length (in./mm): 2.4 / 61.8
 * Eye Relief (in. / mm): Unlimited
 * Click Value in.@100 yds / mm@100m: .5 / 14
 * Adj Range in.@100yds / m@100m: 70 / 1.9
 * Mounting Length (in. / mm): 1.1 / 28

About Bushnell
Bushnell has been the industry leader in high-performance sports optics for more than 50 years. The company's guiding principle is to provide the highest quality, most reliable, and most affordable sports optics products on the market. Bushnell product lines enhance the enjoyment of every outdoor pursuit, including nature study, hunting, fishing, birding, and stargazing. Indoors, the company's binoculars bring the audience closer to the action in fast-moving sports or the fine arts at theaters and concerts.



A reliable, 3 MOA red dot sight with unlimited eye relief for handguns and shotguns.

For speed and assurance, nothing else comes close.
feature_bullets: Matte black featuring a 3 MOA Dot reticle with 11 brightness settings; Mounts easily on most picatinny rails and is compatible with pistols, shotguns, rifles and muzzleloaders
Waterproof construction: O ring sealed optics stay dry inside, even when totally immersed in water. Parallax - 50
Shockproof construction: Built to withstand bumps, bangs, drops and the rough and tumble environment of the field
Nitrogen purged fog proofing: Nitrogen inside the scope ensures interior optical surfaces won’t fog due to humidity or rapid temperature change
